oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Association between Local (Udder) Clinical Signs and Important Outcomes of Clinical Mastitis Episodes in Dairy Cattle
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Wenz, J. R.
Elia, R.
Whitman, K.
Garry, F. B.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Clinical mastitis
CM
dairy cattle
mammary gland
mild systemic disease
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Clinical mastitis (CM) is the most common infectious disease of dairy cattle and is responsible for significant economic losses. There are many local clinical signs associated with inflammatory changes of the mammary gland during bacterial infection. Treatment and prognosis of CM is often decided based on one or more of these clinical signs, however, there have been no studies evaluating the association of important outcomes associated with CM and the presence of these signs in cows with mild systemic disease.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2005; 169
